title.narrative: STRENGTHENED NATIONAL CAPACITY

description.narrative: Government and other national partners have increased capacity at national and subnational levels for improved implementation, monitoring and inclusive sector planning, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and other national partners have increased capacity at national and subnational levels for improved implementation,monitoring and inclusive sector planning

description.narrative: Progress was made in system strengthening, with particular focus on advocacy, evidence generation, capacity building and sector coordination. GEAR 2021 produced an agreed framework, leading to reopening of schools in May 2021. ;Progress in the provision of textbooks, coupled with bolstering sector coordination, holds promise towards the implementation of the new national curriculum – a key national priority in South Sudan. Along with ongoing advocacy, achievements have been made to build systems for data and evidence generation. Support to build and strengthen capacities of education stakeholders at various levels constitutes a key investment to sustain education systems in South Sudan.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
